DataElement.preferredName: Local Pathology Review Hematoxylin and Eosin Staining Method Fixed Slide Complete Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether the local pathology review of the H&E slide derived from QC FFPE tumor tissue was completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Local Pathology Review Hematoxylin and Eosin Staining Method Fixed Slide Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria._Hematoxylin-and-eosin, or H&E, is a routine staining procedure of tissue sections. This staining method uses two separate dyes, one staining the nucleus and the other staining the cytoplasm and connective tissue. Hematoxylin is a dark purplish dye that stains the chromatin (nuclear material) within the nucleus. Eosin is an orangish-pink to red dye that stains the cytoplasmic material including connective tissue and collagen._A slide on which a fixed specimen has been mounted._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria.

Concepts.definition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria.

Property.preferredName: Hematoxylin and Eosin Staining Method Fixed Slide Complete
Property.preferredDefinition: Hematoxylin-and-eosin, or H&E, is a routine staining procedure of tissue sections. This staining method uses two separate dyes, one staining the nucleus and the other staining the cytoplasm and connective tissue. Hematoxylin is a dark purplish dye that stains the chromatin (nuclear material) within the nucleus. Eosin is an orangish-pink to red dye that stains the cytoplasmic material including connective tissue and collagen.:A slide on which a fixed specimen has been mounted.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: Hematoxylin-and-eosin, or H&E, is a routine staining procedure of tissue sections. This staining method uses two separate dyes, one staining the nucleus and the other staining the cytoplasm and connective tissue. Hematoxylin is a dark purplish dye that stains the chromatin (nuclear material) within the nucleus. Eosin is an orangish-pink to red dye that stains the cytoplasmic material including connective tissue and collagen.
A slide on which a fixed specimen has been mounted.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
